meanings.definition: To pay or give a tenth part of one's income, especially to a church or religious organization.
meanings.sent1: Every month, she tythed a portion of her salary to support the local church.
meanings.sent2: The community tythed their earnings to help those in need.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel tythed some of its acorns to the bird feeder, sharing with its feathered friends.
meanings.sent4: The river tythed its waters to the thirsty land, nourishing the crops.
meanings.sent5: The student tythed her time to volunteer at the charity, giving back to the community.

meanings.sent1: He found an old tythed receipt in the church archives.
meanings.sent2: The tythed offerings were stored in a special chest.
meanings.sent3: The tythed coins jingled in the church's collection box.
meanings.sent4: The tythed grains filled the granary, ready to be distributed.
meanings.sent5: The tythed fruits were shared among the villagers, celebrating the harvest.
